title.narrative: Integrated Rural Development Sector Project in the Central Provinces - Additional Financing

description.narrative: The additional financing will support the upgrading of underdeveloped or outdated productive rural infrastructure (PRI), thus increasing agricultural and rural productivity. It also aims to improve the integration of strengthened dams and reservoirs, primary and secondary canals, and access roads to facilitate increased agricultural productivity and diversification and reduce vulnerability caused by natural disasters.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Income per hectare in the subproject areas with improved irrigation, flood control, and drainage facilities increased by 20 % from 2014 by 2018.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: At least 300,000 more beneficiaries will have access to improved PRI from 2013 by 2018

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Travel time on improved roads reduced by 50% by 2018.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Time spent collecting water reduced by an average of 2 hours per day (from 4 hours) by 2014.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.

title.narrative: Proportion of off-farm income in total household income increased by 20% (from 53% to 73%) by 2014.

description.narrative: Improved quality, greater coverage, and better integration of rural infrastructure in the Central Region with an increased awareness for the need for O&M.
